links.description: "Schools don't assign grades to help future employers identify the best hires; schools assign grades to motivate better student behavior. links.title: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL)'s AI 'Coup,' Explained
links.description: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) notched a "major coup" Tuesday when it hired John Giannandrea, Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL)'s Google unit's chief of search and artificial intelligence, The New York Times reported. At Apple, Giannandrea will be in charge of running the company's machine learning and artificial intelligence strategy.

links.title: Why Stocks Under $5 Aren't Good Values - Cabot Wealth Network
links.description: Thanks to the sharp market correction of the last two months, concerns about high valuations have mostly fizzled. As values have come crashing back to earth, share prices suddenly look more buyable. That said, it's important not to confuse a low share price with an attractive value.

links.title: Fed's Evans says he's optimistic on inflation, wants rate hikes
links.description: CHICAGO (Reuters) - Chicago Federal Reserve Bank President Charles Evans, one of the Fed's most dovish policymakers, said Saturday that he is optimistic inflation will reach the Fed's 2 percent goal and that slow, gradual rate increases will be appropriate.
